events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their vehicle with another car at an intersection on the morning of May 9th.
Upon review, the claim was categorised under Auto Accident due to the nature of the reported incident and involved assets.
An agent was assigned to the case to guide the claimant through the next steps and assist with documentation.
The customer received official acknowledgement of the claim filing with a timeline provided for subsequent processes.
The insurance company requested copies of the police report, photographs of the vehicle damage, and repair estimates.
The claimant submitted all requested documents including the police report, photos, and preliminary repair quotes.
Investigators began reviewing the submitted evidence to verify the details of the collision and damage extent.
The investigation concluded that the claimant was not at fault and damage assessments matched reported information.
A fair settlement offer was proposed to cover the necessary repairs and associated costs as per policy terms.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the responsive handling of their claim and clear communication throughout.
The claim was formally approved confirming the settlement amount and preparing for payment issuance.
The payment covering the repair costs was successfully issued to the customerâ€™s account as agreed in the settlement.
After confirmation of payment receipt and satisfaction, the claim was officially closed in the insurer's system.
The case files and documents related to the auto accident claim were archived for future reference and compliance.
